text: this is what you'd expect to see if you
go to the American Museum of Natural
History but behind the scenes a thousand
employees are working on education
conservation and research here's a look
at what they're doing
this room is filled with fossils
including the skulls of wooly mammoths
the museum's paleontology collection has
five and a half million specimens
scientists come here to study the
fossils and make sure they're staying
well protected the ichthyology
department has more than 2 million
preserved fish specimens that are kept
in rows of jars this curator is
measuring a new fish species from
Madagascar that was first collected in
the frozen tissue lab has samples from
almost every living animal including a
special collection of endangered species
the samples are kept in liquid nitrogen
vats and cooled to temperatures below
minus 150 degrees Celsius and here
conservators are working on a totem pole
from the northwest coast collection they
figured out a way to remove a layer of
dirt without damaging the original paint
a team of artists collaborate with
scientists to make temporary exhibitions
here they're making models of marine
animals the American Museum of Natural
History has been around for almost 150
years
